intro: Asteroschoenus consanguineus, commonly known as the red-flowered star-sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces striking pink to red flowers in clustered inflorescences. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in swampy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Asteroschoenus consanguineus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
